definition: (of a vapor etc) to rise/to hang in the air
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: Evapotranspiration is the sum of soil evaporation and vegetation transpiration.
sentences.chinese: 蒸散是土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾的总称。

sentences.english: The increase in relative humidity resulted in a significant decrease of the fruit transpiration rates.
sentences.chinese: 京白梨果实蒸腾速率随着相对湿度增大，明显降低。

sentences.english: Vegetation affected tree transpiration of strong, more humid environment.
sentences.chinese: 植被影响树的蒸腾作用强，使环境更加潮湿。

sentences.english: The transpiration rate reached their maximal about 5 days after anthesis, then went down.
sentences.chinese: 蒸腾速率在花后5天达到最大，然后逐渐减小。

sentences.english: The transpiration rate hydrograph of Aneurolepidium dasystachys(Trin.
sentences.chinese: 蒸腾速率过程线进行了研究。

sentences.english: From analysis of the transpiration coefficient, it shows that rice is not much.
sentences.chinese: 蒸腾系数分析，水稻生理需水并非最多。

sentences.english: Transpiration was found to be higher in the west end, where most temperate desert species were distributed.
sentences.chinese: 蒸腾速率在温带荒漠植物分布的西端出现升高的趋势。

sentences.english: Loss of water also includes the transpiration of water to the atmosphere from plants.
sentences.chinese: 水的散失也包括从植物体中蒸腾到大气层中的水。

sentences.english: Daytime change of transpiration rate of wheat leaves appeared as single peak.
sentences.chinese: 小麦蒸腾速率日变化曲线为单峰型，中午最高。

sentences.english: Its transpiration rate (Tr) in fine day is clearly higher than that in overcast day.
sentences.chinese: 栓皮栎叶片晴天的蒸腾速率明显高于阴天。

sentences.english: There was a negative relation between stomatal resistance and transpiration.
sentences.chinese: 气孔扩散阻力与蒸腾强度呈负相关。

sentences.english: The relationship between transpiration and potential evaporation was linear for well-watered seedlings.
sentences.chinese: 很好供水的苗木的蒸腾量与潜在蒸发量成线型相关。

sentences.english: Most of the remaining 10% is released by plants through transpiration.
sentences.chinese: 剩下的10%主要来自于植物的蒸腾作用。

sentences.english: Objective To study the characteristics and immunological activities of the polysaccharides from Polygonatum sibiricum.
sentences.chinese: 研究遮阴对黄精光合特性和蒸腾速率的影响。

sentences.english: The odor of hot pavement and auto exhaust blew into thecar.
sentences.chinese: 路面蒸腾的热浪混合着汽车尾气扑面而来。

sentences.english: Some of you may be feeling extra tired from all that is transpiring .
sentences.chinese: 你们有些人可能会觉得所有的额外疲惫的蒸腾。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
